001package com.telos.loops.error;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
005
006/**
007 * Thrown when the Loops API returns an error response.
008 *
009 * <p>This exception is raised for all HTTP error responses (4xx, 5xx status codes) returned by the
010 * Loops API. It captures the HTTP status code, raw response body, and parsed error message for
011 * detailed error handling.
012 *
013 * <h2>Common Scenarios</h2>
014 *
015 * <ul>
016 *   <li><b>400 Bad Request:</b> Invalid request parameters or malformed JSON
017 *   <li><b>401 Unauthorized:</b> Invalid or missing API key
018 *   <li><b>404 Not Found:</b> Resource not found
019 *   <li><b>429 Too Many Requests:</b> Rate limit exceeded (see {@link RateLimitExceededException})
020 *   <li><b>500 Internal Server Error:</b> Server-side error
021 * </ul>
022 *
023 * <h2>Example Usage</h2>
024 *
025 * <pre>{@code
026 * LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
027 *         .apiKey("your-api-key")
028 *         .build();
029 *
030 * try {
031 *     client.contacts().create(request);
032 * } catch (LoopsApiException e) {
033 *     System.err.println("API Error: " + e.getMessage());
034 *     System.err.println("Status Code: " + e.statusCode());
035 *     System.err.println("Error: " + e.error());
036 *     System.err.println("Raw Body: " + e.rawBody());
037 * } catch (LoopsValidationException e) {
038 *     System.err.println("Validation Error: " + e.getMessage());
039 * }
040 * }</pre>
041 *
042 * <h2>Retry Behavior</h2>
043 *
044 * <p>This exception does not trigger automatic retries. For rate limit errors (HTTP 429), a {@link
045 * RateLimitExceededException} is thrown instead, which includes retry-after information.
046 *
047 * @see RateLimitExceededException
048 * @see LoopsValidationException
049 */
050public class LoopsApiException extends RuntimeException {
051  private final int statusCode;
052  private final String rawBody;
053  private final String error;
054
055  /**
056   * Constructs a new LoopsApiException with a custom message.
057   *
058   * <p>This constructor is used for generic error conditions where no HTTP response is available.
059   *
060   * @param message the error message
061   */
062  public LoopsApiException(String message) {
063    super(message);
064    this.statusCode = 0;
065    this.rawBody = null;
066    this.error = null;
067  }
068
069  /**
070   * Constructs a new LoopsApiException from an HTTP error response.
071   *
072   * <p>The error message is automatically extracted from the response body's "message" or "error"
073   * field if present, otherwise defaults to "HTTP {statusCode}".
074   *
075   * @param statusCode the HTTP status code from the error response
076   * @param rawBody the raw response body as a string
077   */
078  public LoopsApiException(int statusCode, String rawBody) {
079    super(extractMessage(statusCode, rawBody));
080    this.statusCode = statusCode;
081    this.rawBody = rawBody;
082    this.error = extractError(rawBody);
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Returns the HTTP status code from the error response.
087   *
088   * <p>Returns 0 if the exception was constructed without an HTTP response.
089   *
090   * @return the HTTP status code, or 0 if not applicable
091   */
092  public int statusCode() {
093    return statusCode;
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Returns the raw response body from the API.
098   *
099   * <p>This can be useful for debugging or logging the full error response.
100   *
101   * @return the raw response body, or null if not available
102   */
103  public String rawBody() {
104    return rawBody;
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Returns the parsed error message from the response body.
109   *
110   * <p>This is extracted from the "error" field in the JSON response if present.
111   *
112   * @return the error message, or null if not available
113   */
114  public String error() {
115    return error;
116  }
117
118  private static String extractMessage(int statusCode, String rawBody) {
119    String message = "HTTP " + statusCode;
120    try {
121      if (rawBody != null && !rawBody.isEmpty()) {
122        ObjectMapper mapper = new ObjectMapper();
123        JsonNode node = mapper.readTree(rawBody);
124        if (node.has("message")) {
125          message += ": " + node.get("message").asText();
126        } else if (node.has("error")) {
127          message += ": " + node.get("error").asText();
128        }
129      }
130    } catch (Exception e) {
131      // Ignore parsing errors
132    }
133    return message;
134  }
135
136  private static String extractError(String rawBody) {
137    try {
138      if (rawBody != null && !rawBody.isEmpty()) {
139        ObjectMapper mapper = new ObjectMapper();
140        JsonNode node = mapper.readTree(rawBody);
141        if (node.has("error")) {
142          return node.get("error").asText();
143        }
144      }
145    } catch (Exception e) {
146      // Ignore parsing errors
147    }
148    return null;
149  }
150}
